main_definition: Mine refers to something that belongs to or is under the ownership of a particular person, typically used as an idiom in English.

meanings_and_examples.example: The diamond ring on my finger is mine.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Under the ground resource owned by a person or country
meanings_and_examples.example: This area has large deposits of gold and silver mines, which are controlled by the government.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Exclusive right to something (as in writing, music, etc.)
meanings_and_examples.example: The author holds exclusive rights to this novel; it is their mine.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to a person's personal feelings or emotions that they feel deeply about.
meanings_and_examples.example: She let out an exasperated sigh, 'mine,' she muttered under her breath when talking about the stressful day at work.
